void SYS_SubscribeToEvent ( SYS_EventId_t  id,
SYS_EventReceiver_t *  recv 
)

Subscribe a receiver to an event. The same receiver may be subscribed to multiple events by calling this function several times.

Parameters:
[in]id- event ID
[in]recv- receiver's descriptor

Parameters:
[in]id- event ID
[in]data- associated data that will be passed to callback functions of event's receivers

bool SYS_MutexLock ( SYS_Mutex_t *const  mutex,
SYS_MutexOwner_t *const  owner 
)

Makes the asynchronous request to lock the mutex. 

 Example:
    DECLARE_MUTEX(aesMutex);
    SYS_MutexOwner_t sspOwnerOfAesMutex = {.SYS_MutexLockConf = callback};

    ...
    if (!SYS_MutexLock(&aesMutex, &sspOwnerOfAesMutex))
      return; // Wait the callback function.
    // Work with the resource which is locked by the mutex.
Parameters:
[in]mutex- the pointer to created mutex.
[in]owner- the pointer to owner's structure. Memory for this structure is allocated by the owner. Memory can't be reused by owner the mutex is locked by the owner.
Returns:
true - the locking operation finishes successfuly otherwise false - the operation was postponed. The SYS_MutexLockConf() will be called when the mutex is locked for this owner.
bool SYS_MutexUnlock ( SYS_Mutex_t *const  mutex,
SYS_MutexOwner_t *const  owner 
)

Unlocks a mutex using synchronous request.

Note:
The mutex will be unlocked immediately.
Parameters:
[in]mutex- the pointer to a locked mutex.
[in]owner- the pointer to owner's structure. Memory for this structure can be reused after this operation.
Returns:
true - the unlocking operation finishes successfuly otherwise false - the mutex is not locked by the owner.
bool SYS_IsMutexLocked ( SYS_Mutex_t *const  mutex,
SYS_MutexOwner_t *const  owner 
)

Checks whether mutex is locked.

Parameters:
[in]mutex- the pointer to a locked mutex.
[in]owner- the pointer to owner's structure. Memory for this structure can be reused after this operation.
Returns:
true - the mutex is locked by the owner, false - the mutex is not locked by the owner.
INLINE void SYS_PostTask ( SYS_TaskId_t  taskId)

Posts a task to the task manager, which is later processed by the task handler of the corresponding stack layer.

A task is processed when the SYS_RunTask() function.

Parameters:
[in]taskId- ID of the posted task. The application's ID is APL_TASK_ID.

Definition at line 131 of file sysTaskManager.h.

bool SYS_RunTask ( void  )

This function is called by the stack or from the main() function to process tasks.

If several tasks have been posted by the moment of the function's call, they are executed in order of layers' priority: a task of the layer with the highest priority is executed first.

SYS_InitStatus_t SYS_SysInit ( void  )

Initializes the microconroller and the radio chip.

This is the first stack function to be called by the application in the main() function.

Parameters:
none
Returns:
Initialization result
static uint16_t SYS_GetRandomNumber ( void  ) [inline, static]

Generates a random two-bytes number.

Generation of a random number is based on the seed value created in ZDO with the use of the radio (if the radio supports such mechanism). The stack creates the seed value on startup and updates it periodically later on.

Returns:
A random number in the range 0x000 - 0xFFFF

Definition at line 142 of file sysUtils.h.

uint16_t SYS_GetNormalizedRandomNumber ( uint16_t  upperLimit)

Generates a random two-bytes number normalized by given upper limit.

Generation of a random number is based on the seed value created in ZDO with the use of the radio (if the radio supports such mechanism). The stack creates the seed value on startup and updates it periodically later on.

Parameters:
[in]upperLimit- The upper limit of random number
Returns:
A normalized random number in the range 0x000 - upper limit
int SYS_GetRandomSequence ( uint8_t *  buffer,
unsigned long  size 
)

Generates a sequence of random numbers and copies them into the buffer.

The function uses the same mechanism as the SYS_GetRandomNumber() function, but creates the specified number of random bytes.

Parameters:
[out]buffer- The buffer to hold generated random data
[in]size- The number of bytes of random data to compute and store in the buffer
Returns:
0 - indicates successful completion
INLINE uint16_t SYS_Crc16Ccitt ( uint16_t  initValue,
uint8_t  byte 
)

Calculates CRC using CRC-16-CCITT algorithm.

Parameters:
[in]initValue- CRC initial value
[in]byte- next byte to calculate CRC
Returns:
calculated CRC value
